Aeolaeka.name: Aeolaeka
Aeolaeka.Cdescription: Aeolaekas, also known as stone azatas, embody the slow but inevitable chaos of rock itself. Stone is often thought to be steadfast and unchanging, but, when viewed on a grander scale over vast periods of time, stone can transform into things as diverse as intricate crystals and fine powder. To the aeolaeka, anything that could become either sand or diamond is the very incarnation of the chaos of reality-just on a slower scale. As a result of their stone affinity, aeolaekas are less capricious than other azatas, and some have willingly forged lasting accords or agreements with mortals. Stone-skinned aeolaekas are sometimes mistaken for statues and use this fact to hide in plain sight when they don't want their presence known.

items.name: Языки (постоянное)
items.description:
Цель может понимать все слова, независимо от языка, а также говорить на языках других существ. В смешанной группе существ, каждый раз, когда цель говорит, она может выбрать существо и говорить на языке, который это существо понимает, даже если цель не знает, что это за язык.

Усиление (7-й): Продолжительность становится 8 часов.

items.name: Земные оковы (по желанию)
items.description:
Используя вес земли, вы препятствуете полету цели, с эффектами в зависимости от ее спасброска Стойкости. Если существо благополучно достигает земли, оно не получает урона при падении.

Критический успех: Цель невредима

Успех: Цель благополучно приземляется с высоты вплоть до 120 футов

Провал: Цель благополучно приземляется с высоты вплоть до 120 футов. Если она касается земли, то 1 раунд не может @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.cS9nfDRGD83bNU1p]{Лететь}, левитировать, или другим образом оторваться от земли.

Критический провал: Цель благополучно приземляется с высоты вплоть до 120 футов. Если она касается земли, то 1 минуту не может @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.cS9nfDRGD83bNU1p]{Лететь}, левитировать, или другим образом оторваться от земли.

items.name: Earthglide
items.description: An aeolaeka can Burrow through any earthen matter, including rock. When they do so, the aeolaeka moves at their full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnels or signs of their passing.

items.name: Liberate the Earth
items.description:
The aeolaeka conjures churning stones, creating a @Template[type:line|distance:60]{60-foot-long line} of rolling boulders that deals [[/r 10d6[bludgeoning]]] damage. All creatures in the area must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:32] save, after which the area becomes difficult terrain for 24 hours before the leftover stone crumbles to dust. The aeolaeka can't Liberate the Earth for [[/br 1d4 #Liberate the Earth Recharge]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Success The creature takes no damage.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage, is knocked prone, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} by the rubble (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} DC 32).

items.name: Sacred Hammer
items.description: Any bludgeoning weapon becomes a holy striking weapon while the aeolaeka wields it.

items.name: Statue
items.description: Until the next time they act, the aeolaeka appears to be a statue. They have an automatic result of 45 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as a statue.

Afziaka Brute.name: Afziaka Brute
Afziaka Brute.Cdescription:
An afziaka brute arises from a horse, bull, or other large animal.

Vrykolakas vampires use animals as tools to carry their spirits when they would otherwise be slain. The animal usually dies as the vampire is reborn, but some live on in painful starvation.

items.name: Растоптать
items.description:
Средний или меньше, копыто, @Check[type:reflex|dc:23|basic:true]

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Trample]

Afziaka Stalker.name: Afziaka Stalker
Afziaka Stalker.Cdescription:
Big predatory animals like dire wolves or hyaenodons might survive as an afziaka stalker, magically able to stalk their quarry.

Vrykolakas vampires use animals as tools to carry their spirits when they would otherwise be slain. The animal usually dies as the vampire is reborn, but some live on in painful starvation.

items.name: Раздирать
items.description:
Коготь

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Rend]

Agorron Guard.name: Agorron Guard
Agorron Guard.Cdescription:
Masters of mausoleums and keepers of crypts, the dread creatures called tomb giants are anathema to all living beings, but especially so to other types of giants. Long ago, so the legends say, tomb giants sold their souls in exchange for unfathomable necromantic powers. With whom they made this foul bargain remains a mystery-if the rumors hold any truth at all. Still, tomb giants' power over undeath remains undeniable, and nearly all of them embrace a fervent passion for necromancy.

Tomb giants construct massive gothic settlements in haunted valleys and on forsaken hillsides, far enough away from the societies of smaller people that they remain relatively undisturbed, but close enough that they can raid the graveyards of nearby villages with impunity.

Elder tomb giants-those who have animated countless hordes of humanoid zombies and skeletons and yearn for even greater challenges-enjoy the thrill of subduing, slaying, and reanimating their fellow giants. Taiga giants in particular are choice prey to an experienced tomb giant, as their larger cousins make formidable undead guardians and warriors.

A tomb giant views its mortal life as only one part of its existence. After death, most tomb giants are themselves reanimated as undead, who then continue to practice their necromantic arts.

Many kinds of giants lurk in the inhospitable corners of the world, making their homes in unlikely locales ranging from fetid sinkholes and ruined battlefields to mass graveyards and barren badlands.

items.name: Обрекающее касание
items.description: Когти стража Агоррона несут в себе злополучную силу их отвратительных богов. Существо, пораженное ударом когтей стража, становится @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Обречено 1}.

items.name: Фонтан смерти
items.description: Гигант гробниц обращает духовный прилив на только что умершее существо, временно превращая его в бурлящий сосуд негативной энергии. Гигант гробниц прикасается к существу, умершему за последние 24 часа, наполняя его плоть и кости негативной энергией. Один раз в течение следующего часа этот гигант гробниц может потратить одиночное действие (с любого расстояния), чтобы выпустить из трупа эту негативную энергию @Template[type:burst|distance:15]{15-футовым взрывом}, наносящим [[/r 10d10[negative]]]{10d10 негативного урона} (простой спасбросок @Check[type:fortitude|dc:36|basic:true]); если энергия не высвобождена до конца часа, то она безвредно рассеивается. Гигант гробниц не может использовать "Фонтан смерти", пока предыдущий труп остается насыщенным.

items.name: Wicked Blow
items.description: The Agorron guard makes a Strike with their scythe. A creature damaged by this attack takes [[/r 3d6[bleed]]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}.

Ancient Skaveling.name: Ancient Skaveling
Ancient Skaveling.Cdescription:
Hideous necromantic rituals give rise to skavelings, or ghoul bats, monstrosities that are not true ghouls but instead are specifically crafted undead creatures. Their creators are the bloodsucking urdefhans of the Darklands, who create skavelings from giant bats specially raised on diets of toxic fungus and the flesh of ghouls-especially brains harvested from these undead. Upon reaching maturity, these giant bats are ritually slain via the use of cytillesh oil. While this poison simply rots away the flesh of most creatures, one of these specially prepared bats will immediately rise from death as a skaveling after succumbing to its effects.

Despite its tattered wings and sagging skin, a skaveling is more than capable of flight, even when carrying a creature mounted on its back-urdefhans often use skavelings as mounts in this way. Their intelligence is more advanced than that of the typical giant bat, and in combat they function more as allies than as mere mounts, capable of making their own tactical decisions. Yet even though they can reason and think, skavelings remain loyal to the urdefhans who created them, and they never take actions in a fight that would knowingly put their masters in harm's way.

Anguished Sarenite.name: Anguished Sarenite
Anguished Sarenite.Hdescription: The gold religious symbol of a former priest of Sarenrae is haunted by the priest's tormented soul.
Anguished Sarenite.disable: @Check[type:diplomacy|dc:28] to bring the spirit to its senses, or @Check[type:religion|dc:24] (expert) to banish it

Animated Fireplace.name: Animated Fireplace
Animated Fireplace.Cdescription: Many animated objects have useful functions but become dangers when uncontrolled.

items.name: Броня конструкта (твердость 7)
items.description: Как обычные объекты, оживший камин имеет Твердость. Эта Твердость снижает любой получаемый урон на величину этой Твердости. Как только ОЗ ожившего камина снижаются ниже половины его ОЗ, или сразу после получения урона от критического попадания, его броня конструкта ломается и КБ снижается до 20.

items.name: Броня конструкта (твердость 7)
items.description: Как обычные объекты, ожившая чайная тележка имеет Твердость. Эта Твердость снижает любой получаемый урон на величину этой Твердости. Как только ОЗ ожившей чайной тележки снижаются ниже половины ее ОЗ, или сразу после получения урона от критического попадания, ее броня конструкта ломается и КБ снижается до 20.

Aquatic Ooze.name: Aquatic Ooze
Aquatic Ooze.Cdescription: These dangerous oozes are the bane of any who travel through swamps, marshes, or damp caves. Easily masquerading as pools of clear water or patches of wet stone, gray oozes lie in wait for unwary victims to reach down for a drink or step into what appears to be a puddle, then lash out with whiplike pseudopods to ensnare and consume their hapless prey.

Arboreal Snag.name: Arboreal Snag
Arboreal Snag.Cdescription:
Arboreals can be victims of undeath like any other living creature, but without bones or flesh, their undead take a different form. When an arboreal shivers to life as undead, it often animates as a snag-a leafless, skeletal dead tree that haunts its forest, attacking any living creature it can catch. An arboreal snag is mindless and difficult to control, but some necromancers use them as forest guardians.

While many arboreals are comfortable remaining still for prolonged periods of time, arboreal snags tend to be restless, meandering in a region they consider their domain. This territory is sometimes evident from battered forest animals or trampled undergrowth that litters the ground, but forest creatures soon learn to avoid the area entirely. It doesn't take long for regions haunted by arboreal snags to grow desolate and unhealthy, and locals often dub such regions as haunted or cursed.

Arboreal Snag (Axan Wood).name: Arboreal Snag (Axan Wood)
Arboreal Snag (Axan Wood).Cdescription:
Arboreals can be victims of undeath like any other living creature, but without bones or flesh, their undead take a different form. When an arboreal shivers to life as undead, it often animates as a snag-a leafless, skeletal dead tree that haunts its forest, attacking any living creature it can catch. An arboreal snag is mindless and difficult to control, but some necromancers use them as forest guardians.

While many arboreals are comfortable remaining still for prolonged periods of time, arboreal snags tend to be restless, meandering in a region they consider their domain. This territory is sometimes evident from battered forest animals or trampled undergrowth that litters the ground, but forest creatures soon learn to avoid the area entirely. It doesn't take long for regions haunted by arboreal snags to grow desolate and unhealthy, and locals often dub such regions as haunted or cursed.

Arghun the Annihilator.name: Arghun the Annihilator
Arghun the Annihilator.Cdescription:
Typically, crawling hands are formed when severed appendages are endowed with a crude sentience by evil necromantic energies that turn them into tireless killers. Yet crawling hands can also arise spontaneously, usually when a creature loses an appendage in a place rife with necromantic energy or with a connection to the Negative Energy Plane.

A crawling hand formed from the appendage of a Medium creature is quick and agile, skittering in the shadows until it can strike its prey.

items.name: Grip Throat
items.description: A Medium or smaller creature that is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the crawling hand has difficulty speaking and must spend an extra action to perform any action with the verbal trait.

items.name: Mark Quarry
items.description: A crawling hand can be assigned a quarry by anointing the hand with a drop of the intended quarry's blood. If the hand ever has no quarry, it automatically gains the next creature it damages as its quarry. The hand gains a +1 circumstance bonus to Perception checks when it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} its quarry, to Survival checks when it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Tracks} its quarry, and damage rolls when it Strikes its quarry.

Ashes of Despair.name: Ashes of Despair
Ashes of Despair.Hdescription: Swirling ashes fill the room and form into the semblance of a massive predatory bird that swoops upon those in the chamber, draining their life force away.
Ashes of Despair.disable: @Check[type:occultism|dc:44] (master) to disrupt and counteract the shadow magic animating the ashes, or @Check[type:religion|dc:42] (master) to exorcise the animating spirit. Disabling the trap requires three successful checks, in any combination of Occultism and Religion checks.
Ashes of Despair.reset: The haunt resets immediately when there are no creatures in area F9. Any previous successes from attempts to Disable the haunt persist when it's later triggered. After three successes, the haunt doesn't reset.
Ashes of Despair.routine:
(1 action) The shadowy shape sends streams of scouring ash toward the mouth, eyes, and nose of each creature in the room, dealing [[/r (3d12+20)[slashing]]] damage and requiring a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:42] save. Creatures that don't need breathe can't be sickened by the haunt and creatures that don't see can't be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} by it.

Critical Success The creature takes no damage and is blinded for 1 round.

Success The creature takes half damage, is blinded for 1 round, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Failure The creature takes full damage, is blinded for 1 minute, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature takes full damage, is blinded for 1 minute, is sickened 2, and is unable to use any spells or abilities with the verbal trait while it is sickened.

Avian Rage.name: Avian Rage
Avian Rage.Hdescription: Hundreds of panicked whippoorwills swarm through the area.
Avian Rage.disable: @Check[type:nature|dc:43] (master) to calm the birds, @Check[type:occultism|dc:45] (master) to alter your aura, or @Check[type:performance|dc:45] (master) to imitate the living
Avian Rage.reset: The trap deactivates and resets if 1 minute passes without any undead or creatures with negative healing in the garden.
Avian Rage.routine: (1 action) The birds swarm wildly through the garden, pecking and slashing at all undead creatures and creatures with negative healing in the garden, dealing [[/r (3d10+20)[slashing]]] damage and [[/r 1d10[bleed]]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:44|basic:true]).

Azmakian Effigy.name: Azmakian Effigy
Azmakian Effigy.Cdescription:
Xar-Azmak, the demonic Lord of Rust, was destroyed long ago by Dispater. Some weapons of his infernal legions remain and among the most infamous are Azmakian effigies: fearsome infernal constructs shaped in his image.

Although made of iron, an Azmakian effigy's exterior is thick with rust that flakes off as the construct moves and fights. Effigies charge into battle on massive hooves, impaling enemies on long, curving horns. The effigy's most well-known attack-and the ability that makes even the bravest warrior tremble-is their terrible rusting breath, which can reduce even legendary magical weapons to useless scrap. Wise adventurers attempt to fight an effigy at a distance, but these constructs are surprisingly swift and able to outrun many foes.

The secret to creating Azmakian effigies is thought to be lost, but infernal libraries might still contain the necessary rituals and list of ingredients. Xar-Azmak once commanded ranks of effigies that numbered in the thousands, but most of those who survived his destruction were trapped in Hell, where they were pursued by Dispater's forces and eventually destroyed. Those few who offered their services to Xar-Azmak's devoted worshippers on Golarion survived this purge. With the death of Xar-Azmak, much of the lore to repair the effigies was lost. When one of these constructs is found, they're often suffering some form of long-term damage.

items.name: Истинное зрение (постоянное)
items.description: Вы видите вещи в пределах 60 футов, такими какие они есть на самом деле. Мастер кидает `тайную` проверку на Противодействие любой `иллюзии` или `трансмутации` в области, но только с целью определения видите ли вы через них (например, если проверка была успешной против заклинания `полиморфа`, то вы видите истинную сущность существа, но не заканчиваете действие заклинания `полиморфа`).

items.name: Языки (постоянное)
items.description:
Цель может понимать все слова, независимо от языка, а также говорить на языках других существ. В смешанной группе существ, каждый раз, когда цель говорит, она может выбрать существо и говорить на языке, который это существо понимает, даже если цель не знает, что это за язык.

Усиление (7-й): Продолжительность становится 8 часов.

items.name: Ясновиденье (по желанию)
items.description: Вы создаете невидимый парящий глаз в месте, в пределах дистанции заклинания (даже за пределами линии видимости или линии эффекта). Глаз не может двигаться, но вы можете видеть во всех направлениях с этой точки, как если бы использовали свои обычные зрительные чувства.

items.name: Прочесть знамения (по желанию)
items.description: Вы заглядываете в будущее. Выберите конкретную цель или активность, которую вы планируете совершить в пределах 1 недели, либо событие, которое как вы предполагаете может произойти в течение 1 недели. Вы узнаете таинственную подсказку или совет, часто в форме рифмы или предзнаменования, которые могут помочь с выбранным событием.

items.name: Снятие проклятия (по желанию)
items.description: Ваше прикосновение отводит проклятие от существа. Вы пытаетесь противодействовать одному проклятию поражающему цель. Если проклятие исходит от проклятого предмета или другого внешнего источника, успех означает, что целевое существо может избавить себя от проклятого предмета, но оно не снимает проклятие с предмета.

items.name: Яснослышанье (по желанию)
items.description: Вы создаете невидимое парящее ухо в месте, находящемся в пределах досягаемости (даже если оно находится вне вашей прямой видимости или линии эффекта). Оно не может двигаться, но вы можете слышать через ухо, как будто используете обычные чувства слуха.

items.name: Чревовещание (по желанию)
items.description:
Всякий раз, когда вы говорите или устно издаете какой-либо другой звук, вы можете сделать так, чтобы ваша речь казалась исходящей откуда-то еще в пределах 60 футов, и когда вы говорите, то можете свободно изменять ее местоположение. Любое существо, которое слышит этот звук, может попытаться не поверить вашей иллюзии.

Усиление (2-й): Продолжительность заклинания увеличивается до 1 часа, и вы еще можете менять интонацию, качество и другие аспекты своего голоса. Прежде чем существо сможет попытаться не поверить в вашу иллюзию, оно должно активно попытаться сделать проверку Восприятия, или иным образом использовать действия для взаимодействия со звуком.

items.name: Bardic Lore
items.description: Sphinxes are naturally curious, and their love of puzzles and mysteries leads them to gather information on a broad range of topics. Sphinxes have the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.uVXEZblPRuCyPRua]{Bardic Lore} bard feat, allowing them to Recall Knowledge on any topic.

items.name: Полулаты стойкости +2
items.description: Полулаты состоят из большей части верха пластинчатого доспеха, используемых в полном латном доспехе, с более легкой или редкой защитой рук и ног стальными пластинами. Это обеспечивает некоторую защиту полных лат с большей гибкостью и скоростью. Комплект этого доспеха поставляется вместе с надеваемым под низ @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.zBYEU9E7034ENCmh]{Стеганым доспехом} и парой @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Ix2vicchE79d6Cl3]{Латных рукавиц}.

Benefactor's End.name: Benefactor's End
Benefactor's End.Hdescription: A spectral assailant drives a stake into a dying vampire's heart; the vampire collapses and releases a surge of negative energy.
Benefactor's End.disable: @Check[type:religion|dc:28] (expert) to drain away the haunt's negative energy
Benefactor's End.reset: Unless disabled, the haunt materializes again on the next moonrise.

Blaanlool.name: Blaanlool
Blaanlool.Cdescription:
Dwellers of brackish coastal salt marshes and fetid bogs and swamps, marsh giants are hideous in appearance indeed, with fishlike mouths, slimy gray-green skin, and dark, beady eyes. They prefer to eat the flesh of those they slay in battle, but many are also cannibals. It is perhaps this vicious behavior that keeps the creatures in check, for if a fellow marsh giant becomes too dangerous and powerful, it runs the risk of being ambushed and consumed by its clan.

Marsh giants are insular and mysterious, dedicating much of their lives to zealous worship of sea-dwelling deities or stranger entities. While there is no central religion followed by all marsh giants, many are known to venerate the demon lord Dagon, while others worship even more powerful monstrosities from the Elder Mythos, such as distant, dreaming Cthulhu.

Only rarely do more than a dozen marsh giants settle together in a location, but when they do it is often for a religious purpose. Whatever call from the deep draws them together also tugs at nearby creatures such as boggards or skum, who look upon marsh giants in fear and reverence. The grim, terrifying chants and screams coming from such an encampment are a sure sign of terror to come for any other residents of the area.

Barely topping 11 feet tall and 1,000 pounds, marsh giants are small for giants but make up for their relatively diminutive stature with their zealotry.

items.name: Религиозный символ Дагона
items.description: Этот кусок дерева или серебра гравирован изображением представляющим божество. Некоторые сакральные заклинатели, такие как жрецы, могут использовать религиозный символ своего божества как сакральный фокус при использовании некоторых умений и сотворении некоторых заклинаний. Чтобы использовать религиозный символ, его надо держать в одной руке.

items.name: Кольцо сопротивления холоду
items.description: Кольцо дает вам сопротивление 5 против урона энергией холода. Каждое кольцо создано, чтобы защищать от урона определенного вида энергии, и его внешний вид обычно каким-то образом воплощает этот вид энергии. Например, кольцо сопротивления огню может быть увенчано рубином, а кольцо сопротивления холоду сапфиром.

items.name: Тряска крюком
items.description:
Требования: Существо находящееся рядом с болотным гигантом @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Ничком} в воде глубиной хотя бы 1 фут

Эффект: Болотный гигант использует свой багор, чтобы туда-сюда трясти существо, держа его под водой. Гигант совершает проверку Атлетики против КС Стойкости цели.

Критический успех: Цель получает [[/r (6d6+14)[piercing]]]{6d6+14 колющего урона} и если задерживала дыхание, то теряет 5 раундов воздуха.

Успех: Цель получает [[/r (3d6+14)[piercing]]]{3d6+14 колющего урона} и если задерживала дыхание, то теряет 3 раунда воздуха.

Провал: Цель невредима.

Критический провал: Как провал, но гигант еще роняет свой багор.

items.name: Проворачивание крюка
items.description: Болотный гигант наносит Удар ближнего боя своим багром. При попадании, он проворачивает и дёргает его, раздирая ужасную рану, наносящую существу @Localize[PF2E.PersistentDamage.Bleed3d6.success].

Bloodshroud.name: Bloodshroud
Bloodshroud.Cdescription: During the war between Geb and Nex, necromancers conducted dangerous magical experiments to gain every possible advantage over their enemies. One such endeavor attempted to distill the essence of vampiric mists to create a protective shroud for an army of undead maguses.

Bulette.name: Bulette
Bulette.Cdescription:
Bulettes are fearsome predators that roam just beneath the surface of desolate wilderness areas. When they burrow through the ground, only the fin of their thickly armored backs protrudes above-at least until they are ready to leap out and strike their prey. Their appearance, appetite, and iconic dorsal fin have earned the nickname "landshark."

A typical bulette claims a territory of approximately 500 square miles. When it finds an area rich in food, such as a farming village, it adds that area to its regular patrol route. Over the course of a few months, it can wipe entire settlements off the map. Bulettes are fiercely competitive creatures that battle relentlessly with other predators in their territory. They actively avoid contact or conflict with other members of their kind unless seeking a mate. Bulette pairs share territory and mate for life-a mated pair of bulettes being the only known exception to the creature's penchant for solitude. They rear their young for a short period of time. The mated pair instruct the young bulette how to hunt, teaching their spawn which creatures are easiest to kill and which creatures to avoid. The mated pair drive off their young after its first successful hunt.

The first bulettes were magically created guardians, intended to serve as frightening pets for a power-hungry and sadistic wizard. The technique for their creation, as well as their original purpose, has since been lost to history, and multiple conflicting accounts of ancient texts exist with dozens of wizards claiming to have been the first inventor of the notorious beast. Some sages postulate that the original inventor may have been an elf-a theory born out of little more than the curious fact that bulettes, for all their ravenous nature, seem to find elf flesh unpalatable. Unfortunately for elves who stumble into a bulette's path, bulettes are no less likely to kill them than any other intruder, simply leaving the bodies unconsumed where they fall.

Bursting Bone Vault.name: Bursting Bone Vault
Bursting Bone Vault.Hdescription: This bone-filled vault disgorges its contents the moment the vault door slides open.
Bursting Bone Vault.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:20] (trained) or @Check[type:stealth|dc:20] (trained) to carefully open the vault door without disturbing the bones

items.name: Collapse
items.description:
Trigger A creature opens the door to the vault

Effect The bones spill from the vault and into the adjacent corridor, dealing [[/r (2d10+13)[bludgeoning]]] damage to each creature within 10 feet of the door (@Check[type:reflex|dc:20|basic:true]). The area becomes difficult terrain.

Button Mash.name: Button Mash
Button Mash.Hdescription: The room floods with harmful effects by pressing a magic sigil on a console. Each sigil causes different results. There are six sigils on the console.
Button Mash.disable: @Check[type:arcana|dc:40] (master) to disenchant each sigil (can be done from either side of the reception desk), @Check[type:thievery|dc:43] (master) twice to disable the console (can only be done while behind the reception desk), or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (8th level; counteract DC 40) to counteract each sigil; prevent Noph from pressing the buttons by gaining access to the reception desk or other methods
Button Mash.routine:
(2 actions) Noph frantically pecks and stomps on the console, using each action to press a random sigil. Roll [[/r 1d6 #Pressed Sigil]] to determine which sigil Noph presses. Psychopomps are immune to the effects of these sigils.

1 The area is flooded with holy light, dealing [[/r (3d12+19)[positive]]] damage to each creature in the area (@Check[type:reflex|dc:43|basic:true]).

2 The area is flooded with unholy darkness, dealing [[/r (3d12+19)[negative]]] damage to each creature in the area (@Check[type:reflex|dc:43|basic:true]).

3 The area is flooded with blue flames, dealing [[/r (3d10+19)[fire]]] damage to each creature in the area (@Check[type:reflex|dc:43|basic:true]). On a critical failure, a creature additionally takes [[/r 1d10[persistent,fire]]] damage.

4 A comet streaks through the area, attacking the nearest creature to Noph with a comet Strike.

5 Force tethers sprout from the floor, grasping at intruders. Each creature in the area is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} for 1 round unless they succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:43] save.

6 Ghostly blue mist surrounds each psychopomp in the area, healing them [[/r (3d8+19)[healing]]]{3d8+19} HP and granting them @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealement} for 1 round.

Castigate the Faithless.name: Castigate the Faithless
Castigate the Faithless.Hdescription: Magic forces those who pass by the statue to the ground with sudden force; pressing the bypass button deactivates the trap for 1 minute.
Castigate the Faithless.disable: @Check[type:religion|dc:47] (legendary) to deactivate the trap through prayer, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (8th level; counteract DC 47) to counteract the trap, or press the bypass button
Castigate the Faithless.reset: The trap resets automatically if triggered, after 1 minute if the bypass button is pressed, or after 15 minutes if disabled or counteracted.
Castigate the Faithless.stealth: (master) or @Check[type:perception|dc:50] (legendary) to notice the bypass button hidden in Urgathoa's skeletal feet

Caustic Shower.name: Caustic Shower
Caustic Shower.Hdescription: Contact with the doors, pillars, or statue causes a shower of acid.
Caustic Shower.disable: @Check[type:crafting|dc:48] (master) to ground the charged features or @Check[type:thievery|dc:50] (legendary) to disable the contact sensors

Charghar.name: Charghar
Charghar.Cdescription:
Common urban legends in Geb warn of the vengeful spirits of those who've been cooked alive, collectively called charghars. While many Gebbites eat people in ways that don't involve cooking, there are some undead who've grown bored after centuries of the same diet. There are also some living people in the nation who've resorted to cannibalism: either downtrodden folks who cook and eat their neighbors and kin out of necessity, or socialites who dine on such fare because it's fashionable. Regardless of the reason for cooking people, these efforts can create vengeful undead creatures who lurk wherever meals are being prepared, luring cooks into making careless or deadly mistakes.

Charghars have spectral humanoid forms, while their physical manifestations appear much as they did after they were cooked-as charred remains, gory corpses bearing disembodied butchered chunks that float nearby, or loose assemblages of boiled bones.

Chattering Jaws.name: Chattering Jaws
Chattering Jaws.Cdescription:
Chattering jaws usually serve no purpose other unnerving people by clicking their teeth together. Some chattering jaws only chatter at regular intervals to help tell the time.

Commonly mistaken for undead, animated bones are mindless constructs with no connection to necromancy. The following are examples of typical animated bones.

Choking Tethers.name: Choking Tethers
Choking Tethers.Hdescription: Three shadow tethers form when a creature reaches the hall's midpoint; each lashes, grabs, and crushes creatures in the hall.
Choking Tethers.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:48] (legendary) to disable each tether or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (10th level, counteract DC 48) to counteract each tether
Choking Tethers.routine: (six actions) This trap loses 2 actions each turn for each disabled shadow tether. Each shadow tether has 2 actions it can use to either Strike a creature or Constrict a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} creature, in any combination.

Cleansing Fire.name: Cleansing Fire
Cleansing Fire.Hdescription: Sheets of fire and positive energy blast through the room in waves that obliterate the undead and scorch the living.
Cleansing Fire.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:41] (master) to bleed away the trap's energy, or @Check[type:religion|dc:39] (expert) to recite the appropriate prayers to Urgathoa to stop the trap (Pesabnet knows these prayers and automatically succeeds at checks to recite them). Disabling the trap requires three successful checks, in any combination of Thievery and Religion checks.
Cleansing Fire.reset: The sacred fire disappears 1 minute after no creatures are in the room, and the trap immediately resets
Cleansing Fire.routine:
(1 action) A wall of sacred fire washes back and forth throughout the room, bathing every inch of the space in holy power and dealing [[/r {3d12[fire],3d12[positive]}]]{3d12 fire damage 3d12 positive damage}. Each creature in the trap's area must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:39] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes double damage.

Critical Failure If the creature has negative healing, it is instantly destroyed. Otherwise, it takes double damage and [[/r 1d12[persistent,fire]]] damage.

Cleansing Hall.name: Cleansing Hall
Cleansing Hall.Hdescription: The hall's entry and exit seal with a force barrier, then waves of force surge through the hall.
Cleansing Hall.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:48] (master) to deface the script without triggering, @Check[type:arcana|dc:47] (master) to redirect the magical energy, or @Check[type:religion|dc:46] (master) to quote Pharasmin prayers
Cleansing Hall.reset: The trap deactivates and resets after 1 minute.
Cleansing Hall.routine: (1 action) A wave of force flows down the hall from north to south, dealing [[/r (3d10+20)[force]]] damage to each creature in the corridor. Each creature must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:40|basic:true]. On a failure, a creature is pushed back 5 feet (10 feet on a critical failure). If this movement would cause a creature to hit another creature, both creatures take [[/r 1d6[bludgeoning]]] damage. If this movement would cause a creature to hit a force barrier, the creature takes [[/r 2d6[bludgeoning]]] damage. Animals, plants, and worshippers of Pharasma are immune to this force damage.

Clockwork Rifler.name: Clockwork Rifler
Clockwork Rifler.Cdescription:
These diligent machines guard their assigned posts tirelessly. A typical clockwork soldier stands 6 feet tall and consists of 500 pounds of metal and magic.

Intricate, complex machines, clockworks are built with care by highly skilled engineers. Though their creation involves some amount of magic, they're primarily mechanical, packed with precision-tuned gears and springs working in concert.

The sturdy mainspring within a clockwork must be wound to provide the energy needed to power the device. Some larger clockworks contain a series of springs for different limbs that each need to be wound. A clockwork's crafter creates a unique metal key while building the clockwork; winding the clockwork usually involves inserting the key into the machine's back and turning clockwise. Larger clockworks require greater strength to turn the key, and typically have larger keys to allow for more torque-some even accommodating a team of winders rather than an individual. Programming a clockwork requires both the key and the knowledge to set the program correctly, information usually reserved for the clockwork's creator or owner.

items.name: Двуствольный мушкет
items.description: Этот кремневый мушкет с казёнником имеет 2 ствола, расположенных двуг возле друга. Хотя двуствольный мушкет менее точен, по сравнению с обычным мушкетом, он обеспечивает универсальность вариантов стрельбы. Многие знаменитые шилд-маршалы Алкенстара откладывают свои сбережения, чтобы купить двуствольный мушкет в качестве первого личного оружия.

Cobblebone Swarm.name: Cobblebone Swarm
Cobblebone Swarm.Cdescription:
Graydirge's necromancer-architects used a horrifying rending process to strip the flesh and souls off most bones involved in Graydirge's construction, but modern builders lack the benefit of such gruesomely efficient magic. When haunted bones are embedded in buildings alongside mundane materials, nearby bricks and cobblestones can be infused with necromantic energy. If no one exorcises the spirits haunting the bones, they become trapped and confused, their identities and memories intermingling. After several years, they can form cobblebone swarms, malevolent haunted amalgamations of brick and bone. These vengeful creatures conjure ghostly noises to lure victims down narrow alleys or into dark stone basements, where they pummel them to death and cover their remains beneath piles of bones and brick.

Some have mistaken cobblebone swarms for cobbleswarms, but citizens of Graydirge know to look for nearby apparitions, or studded bones that move when you look away. These are sure signs of a cobblebone swarm, and an indication that one should take a different route to their destination.

Cobblebone swarms look like piles of simple bricks or cobblestones with crooked bones embedded in them, often in the shape of crude faces. As they roll along or float slowly through the air, they leave a ghostly afterimage in their wake.

Collapsing Bridge.name: Collapsing Bridge
Collapsing Bridge.Hdescription: An iron bridge's connectors give way to drop into the lake below.
Collapsing Bridge.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:40|name:Disable Quick Release Mechanism|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to disable one side of the bridge's quick release mechanisms

items.name: Collapse
items.description:
Trigger A Small or larger creature moves more than 20 feet onto the bridge

Effect The bridge chains detach from their connectors, dropping itself and anything on it into the lake 150 feet below. A creature that's adjacent to the ledges to the north or south can attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:33] save to Grab the Edge, but creatures who can't reach the edge fall with the bridge into the toxic water below (unless one side of the bridge remains attached, in which case a creature can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} by clinging to the dangling bridge-requiring a successful @Check[type:athletics|dc:20|traits:action:climb] check to climb the hanging bridge to safety).

Compression Tunnel.name: Compression Tunnel
Compression Tunnel.Hdescription: This shadow tunnel compresses when creatures pass through.
Compression Tunnel.disable: @Check[type:athletics|dc:46] (legendary) twice to push back the shadows or @Check[type:thievery|dc:48] (legendary) three times to pierce through the shadows
Compression Tunnel.routine: (1 action) The tunnel compresses, crushing all creatures in it and dealing [[/r (4d10+22)[bludgeoning]]] damage (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:42|basic:true]). On a failed save, a creature additionally becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} DC 42).

Creeping Crone.name: Creeping Crone
Creeping Crone.Cdescription: Hags are neither immortal nor unageing; if not slain by an enemy, a hag eventually succumbs to old age. A hag who dies in agony or rage can rise again as a witchfire, while those who die of old age might rise again as an undead creature known as a creeping crone. A creeping crone has lost far more than her life; they can't form or join covens, denying them one of a living hag's most distinguishing abilities. This inability, more than their rotting bodies or hunger for flesh, makes creeping crones exiled among their former kin.

items.name: Изменение формы
items.description:
The creeping crone can take on the appearance of any Medium humanoid woman, changing her walking stick to suit her new appearance. This doesn't change her Speed or Strikes, but it might change the damage type her Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Crush the Uninvited.name: Crush the Uninvited
Crush the Uninvited.Hdescription: A warning carved into the door frame magically crushes any who pass through the doorway without Kemnebi's permission.
Crush the Uninvited.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:48] (legendary) to scratch out the warning or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (10th level; counteract DC 48) to counteract the magic in the warning
Crush the Uninvited.stealth: (legendary); @Check[type:perception|dc:20] to notice the warning carved in the door frame

items.name: Implosion
items.description:
Trigger A creature passes through the doorway without Kemnebi's permission

Effect The trap casts implosion on the triggering creature. This is a 10th-level @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.4WS7HrFjwNvTn8T2]{Implosion} spell that deals [[/r 85 #Implosion Damage]]{85} damage (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:47|basic:true]).

Crystallized Agony.name: Crystallized Agony
Crystallized Agony.Hdescription: A violet crystal containing the body of a dead creature, grown from its dying agony, pulses as it exudes motes of flickering energy.
Crystallized Agony.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:33] (master) or @Check[type:survival|dc:35] (master) to know where to Strike a specific crystal perfectly on a facet to cause it to shatter harmlessly
Crystallized Agony.reset: A crystallized agony resets automatically and can be triggered again the next round.

items.name: Стеганый доспех стойкости +2
items.description: Этот доспех представляет собой просто слой тяжелой стеганой ткани, но его иногда используют, потому что он такой недорогой. Стеганый доспех легче повредить и уничтожить, чем другие доспехи. Тяжелый доспех поставляется вместе с включенным в стоимость стеганым доспехом, в качестве надеваемого под низ, хоть он и теряет свой признак удобный, когда носится вместе с тяжелым доспехом. Вы можете носить только эту стеганую подложку, чтобы спать в ней, если ваш тяжелый доспех уничтожен, или когда вы не носите полный тяжелый доспех. Это позволяет вам держать доспехи инвестированными и получать преимущества от силы любых рун связанного тяжелого доспеха, но никто другой не сможет надеть ваш тяжелый доспех без стеганного доспеха.

items.name: Внезапная атака
items.description:
Dead Faine deals an additional 4d6 precision damage to flat-footed creatures. This increases to 6d6 against creatures flat-footed due to Dead Faine's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Feint} or Traitorous Betrayal.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

Decrosia.name: Decrosia
Decrosia.Cdescription:
Rust hags have a knack for technology. They make their homes in hollowed-out factories, abandoned tenements, and other sites of urban decay.

Hags are surprisingly diverse, both in abilities and in their terrain.
Decrosia.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

items.name: Ковен
items.description: Ржавая карга добавляет к своим заклинаниям ковена @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.B3eLlbaPxOYHcs1o]{Проклятие утраченного времени}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.0fYE64odlKqISzft]{Хватка ржавчины} и @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.lKcsmeOrgHtK4xQa]{Призыв конструкта}.

items.name: +1 состояния ко всем спасброскам против магии
Изменение формы
items.description:
Ржавая карга может принять внешность любого `гуманоида` женского пола среднего размера. Это не изменяет ее Скорость или бонусы атаки и урона "Ударов", но может изменить тип урона, наносимого ее "Ударами" (обычно на дробящий).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

items.name: Выстрел карги
items.description: Любое огнестрельное оружие, которым владеет ржавая карга, получает преимущества рун оружия разящего +1 и призрачного касания, и оно нормально функционирует, независимо от того, насколько оно заржавело. Кроме того, когда ржавая карга критически попадает по цели из огнестрельного оружия, цель должна совершить успешный спасбросок @Check[type:fortitude|dc:26], иначе @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Ошеломлена 1}.

items.name: Касание ржавчины
items.description: Прикосновение ржавой карги вызывает быстрое ржавление и коррозию металла. Если карга совершает успешный "Удар" когтем, то наносит [[/r 2d6 #Rusting Touch Damage]]{2d6 урона} (удваивается при критическом попадании) металлическому предмету, который надет на цели или удерживается ею, игнорируя его Твердость. Если карга попадает по ничейному металлическому предмету, он получает этот урон автоматически. Если существо использует реакцию @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.jM72TjJ965jocBV8]{Блок щитом} с металлическим щитом против атаки когтей карги, щит автоматически становится сломан, но никакой другой предмет не ржавеет от этой атаки. Объекты из небесного металла, такого как Адамантин и Орихалк, иммунны к касанию ржавчины.

Demilich Skull.name: Demilich Skull
Demilich Skull.Hdescription: The skull of a defeated demilich is haunted by souls of the demilich's victims.
Demilich Skull.disable: @Check[type:arcana|dc:26], @Check[type:occultism|dc:26], @Check[type:nature|dc:26], or @Check[type:religion|dc:26] to counteract the skull's Broken Gems

Dirge Piper.name: Dirge Piper
Dirge Piper.Cdescription:
Under rare circumstances, an attempt to reanimate a skilled musician or performer as a mindless zombie is impeded by lingering occult magic that anchors a piece of the being's artistic soul to its shambling body. The resulting dirge piper retains a fragment of the person's former intellect and personality, but lacks the coordination and acuity to make true music any longer. Instead, they force air through the cavities and organs of their decomposing bodies to produce haunting piping, squelches, and trumpeting.

Most dirge pipers cling to a sense of fashion from their former lives, often obsessing over the condition of their clothes. They are aware enough of their deteriorating bodies that their own decay drives them into deepening despair. The only thing more disturbing to a dirge piper than their corpse is their own music. Despite hating the sounds they make, they cannot help but produce constant noise from their mouths and their wounds.

Although many necromancers consider the noisy dirge pipers a mistake, dirge pipers can be useful as leaders of other groups of zombies because their piping invigorates their fellow walking corpses. Even their putrid, trumpeting blasts resonate in a way that doesn't harm other zombies.

items.name: Slow
items.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

Drowned Mummy.name: Drowned Mummy
Drowned Mummy.Cdescription: Rarely artificially created, drowned mummies are miserable, dripping undead that have adapted to exist in an aquatic environment, usually over centuries, after their tomb or lair becomes flooded.

Drusilla.name: Drusilla
Drusilla.Cdescription:
At first glance, a huldra seems a simple creature-a human in plain robes or peasant dress, sporting long, unbound hair. These tresses and full skirts in fact disguise the huldra's supernatural features: a hollow wooden back, a long bovine tail, and incredible strength.

Folk legends from the lands of the north describe huldras as the creations of troll witches, intended to lure potential meals to the slaughter. Indeed, a huldra's regeneration is so similar to a troll's that a link between the two creatures seems entirely possible, but huldras despise trolls and resent tales suggesting any connection between them. Rather, huldras are wardens of the woodlands they occupy. Grown from saplings by powerful forest-dwelling fey as a response to humanoid encroachment, huldras protect and parley for the forest itself. Woodland creatures adore huldras, and sometimes approach humans or elves thinking they're huldras. This illusion is shattered if the animal sees the humanoid's back is made of flesh or that they're lacking a tail, at which point the animal recoils and runs away.

Huldras respond well to travelers who show respect and deference for the forest, bestowing those they favor with supernatural luck and fortune. Those who scorn or attack a huldra, or those who mock their distinctive, bovine tails, find themselves plagued by poor decisions and even worse luck. Huldras commonly carry a bad reputation as sirens of the deep forest-cunning monsters who seek to lure woodcutters and unwary adventurers to uncertain ends. These stories largely come from miscreants foolish enough to have treated a huldra rudely and later complain about how they were unjustly persecuted. Even woodcutters and hunters can stay in the good graces of huldras provided they plant few trees to replace what they've taken and don't kill any creatures they don't eat.

Though huldras choose to appear unassuming, the attention they put into disguising the supernatural parts of their bodies is sometimes lacking when it comes to their strength. They often perform feats of strength, like bending horseshoes straight or lifting heavy objects, without realizing they're breaking their carefully crafted facade.

items.name: Speak with Animals (At Will)
items.description: You can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the Diplomacy skill with animals. The spell doesn't make them more friendly than normal. Cunning animals are likely to be terse and evasive, while less intelligent ones often make inane comments.

Electrified Gate.name: Electrified Gate
Electrified Gate.Hdescription: A warded metal gate electrocutes anyone who touches the gate without pressing the bypass button.
Electrified Gate.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:47] (legendary) to destroy the ward, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (8th level; counteract DC 47) to counteract the ward, or press the bypass button
Electrified Gate.reset: The trap resets automatically if triggered, after 1 minute if the bypass button is pressed, or after 15 minutes if disabled or counteracted.
Electrified Gate.stealth: (master) or @Check[type:perception|dc:50|traits:secret] (legendary) to notice the bypass button hidden in a skull's eye socket

Eseneth.name: Eseneth
Eseneth.Cdescription:
Eseneths, commonly known as soul-stitchers, are dispassionate surgeons who repair damaged souls.

Psychopomps preside over death and the cycle of souls.

items.name: Дверь в пространстве (по желанию)
items.description:
Открывая дверь, которая огибает обычное пространство, вы мгновенно переносите себя и любые предметы, которые на вас надеты и которые держите, из своего текущего пространства в свободное пространство в пределах дистанции, которое вы можете видеть. Если в результате этого вы перенесете с собой другое существо, даже если переносите его в межпространственном контейнере, то заклинание пропадает.

Усиление (5-й): Дистанция увеличивается до 1 мили. Вам не надо быть способным видеть свое место назначения, если вы были там ранее и знаете примерное место и дистанцию от вас. Вы временно иммунны на 1 час.

items.name: Свобода движений (постоянное)
items.description: Вы отталкиваете эффекты, которые бы мешали существу или замедляли его движение. Находясь под действием эффекта этого заклинания, цель игнорирует эффекты которые бы давали ей штраф обстоятельства к Скорости. Когда она пытается @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Вырваться} из эффекта дающего состояние @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Обездвижен}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Схвачен} или @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Сдерживаем}, она автоматически преуспевает, если только эффект не магический и большего уровня чем заклинание свобода движения.

items.name: Невидимость (по желанию, только на себя)
items.description:
Покрытая иллюзиями, цель становится @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Невидимой}. Это делает ее @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Необнаруженной} для всех существ, однако существа могут попытаться найти цель, сделав ее для себя @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Спрятанной} (см. Обнаружение существ). Если цель использует враждебное действие, заклинание заканчивается после завершения этого враждебного действия.

Усиление (4-й): Заклинание длится 1 минуту, но не заканчивается если цель использует враждебное действие.

Facetbound Cascader.name: Facetbound Cascader
Facetbound Cascader.Cdescription:
Facetbound cascaders must have been arcane spellcasters in life; in undeath, they draw upon the power of embedded orange prism aeon stones to defend themselves from magical damage and redirect that energy toward their opponents. Despite their incredible intelligence, facetbound cascaders have few memories of their former lives and typically serve the whims of their creator.

Inspired by the work of the Azlanti and their obsessions with aeon stones, certain necromancers strive to tap into those curious magical items to create undead with powerful abilities. A facetbound is created from a living being with an aeon stone surgically attached to their skull who is killed in a specific, secret ritual. Each facetbound must bear a single aeon stone, and this stone determines the powers the facetbound wields (in place of the normal powers of the implanted stone)
Facetbound Cascader.allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. magic

items.name: Effect: Energy Ward (Cold)
items.description: The cascader gains resistance 15 to the triggering damage, replacing any other resistance gained from this ability. The cascader's melee strikes also deal an additional 4d10 damage of this type.

items.name: +2 состояния ко всем спасброскам против магии

Facetbound Nullifier.name: Facetbound Nullifier
Facetbound Nullifier.Cdescription:
Designed to serve as devastatingly powerful foot soldiers against enemies with plentiful magic, facetbound nullifiers shear through magical effects as easily as they slice through flesh and bone. The pale lavender ellipsoid aeon stones they bear are sunk deep into their heads and surrounded by an ugly bruise.

Inspired by the work of the Azlanti and their obsessions with aeon stones, certain necromancers strive to tap into those curious magical items to create undead with powerful abilities. A facetbound is created from a living being with an aeon stone surgically attached to their skull who is killed in a specific, secret ritual. Each facetbound must bear a single aeon stone, and this stone determines the powers the facetbound wields (in place of the normal powers of the implanted stone)
Facetbound Nullifier.allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. magic

items.name: Полный латный доспех стойкости +1
items.description: Пластинчатая доспех состоит из сцепленных пластин, которые заключают почти все тело в стальной панцирь. Он дорогостоящий и тяжелый, и владельцу часто требуется помощь, чтобы надеть его правильно, но он предоставляет одну из лучших защит, что может дать доспех. Комплект этого доспеха поставляется вместе с надеваемым под низ @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.zBYEU9E7034ENCmh]{Стеганым доспехом} и парой @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Ix2vicchE79d6Cl3]{Латных рукавиц}.

items.name: +2 состояния ко всем спасброскам против магии
Клепаный кожаный доспех стойкости +2
items.description: Этот кожаный доспех усилен металлическими заклепками и иногда небольшими металлическими пластинами, обеспечивая большую часть гибкости кожаного доспеха с более надежной защитой.

Floating Femur.name: Floating Femur
Floating Femur.Cdescription:
Floating femurs can deliver a powerful blow. They make handy weapons for those who manage to grab hold of them.

Commonly mistaken for undead, animated bones are mindless constructs with no connection to necromancy. The following are examples of typical animated bones.

items.name: Вонь
items.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:10]{10 футов} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Аура}

Существо попадающее в эту ауру или начинающее в ней свой ход, должно совершить успешный спасбросок @Check[type:fortitude|dc:26] иначе испытывает @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Тошноту 1} (при критическом провале @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Замедлен 1} пока испытывает `тошноту`).

Находясь в этой ауре, существо получает штраф обстоятельства -2 к спасброскам против `болезни` и восстановлению от этого состояния `тошноты`. Существо, успешно совершившее свой спасбросок, временно иммунно на 1 минуту.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.wX9L6fbqVMLP05hn]{Эффект: Вонь}

items.name: Лихорадка гаста
items.description:
Спасбросок: @Check[type:fortitude|dc:26]

Стадия 1: Переносчик не имеет эффектов болезни (1 день)

Стадия 2: [[/r 3d8[negative]]]{3d8 негативного урона} и существо восстанавливает половину ОЗ от всего исцеления (1 день)

Стадия 3: Как стадия 2 (1 день)

Стадия 4: [[/r 3d8[negative]]]{3d8 негативного урона} и существо не восстанавливает ОЗ от исцеления (1 день)

Стадия 5: Как стадия 4 (1 день)

Стадия 6: Смерть и в следующую полночь существо восстает как @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.VC7rtYR4hLxwg7WZ]{Гаст}

items.name: Паралич
items.description: Любое живое существо, по которому попала атака гаста, должно совершить успешный спасбросок @Check[type:fortitude|dc:26] иначе будет @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Парализовано}. Оно может совершать новый спасбросок в конце каждого своего хода и при каждом таком спасброске, КС совокупно снижается на 1.

Ghiasi.name: Ghiasi
Ghiasi.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. divination

items.name: Планарный перехол (только на себя; только в Теневой план или Материальный план)
items.description:
Вы и ваши союзники пересекаете барьеры между планами бытия. Цели перемещаются на другой план, такой как Огненный план, Теневой план или Бездна. Вы должны обладать определенными знаниями о плане назначения и использовать магический камертон, созданный из материала с этого плана, в качестве фокуса для заклинания. В то время как камертоны для большинства известных планов являются необычными, так же как и это заклинание планарного перехода, более смутные планы и демипланы часто имеют камертоны редкого качества.

Заклинание очень неточное, и вы появляетесь в 1d20×25 милях от последнего места, где одна из целей (по вашему выбору) была расположена в последний раз, когда она путешествовала на этот план. Если это первое путешествие на конкретный план для всех целей, вы появляетесь в случайном месте плана. Планарный переход не обеспечивает способов обратного путешествия, однако сотворение заклинания снова позволяет вам вернуться на ваш предыдущий план, если только нет каких-либо смягчающих обстоятельств.

items.name: iзность (по желанию)
items.description:
Цель превращается в iзное состояние. В этом состоянии цель аморфна. Она теряет любой бонус предмета к КБ и все другие эффекты и бонусы от доспеха, а также использует свой модификатор мастерства защиты без доспехов. Она получает сопротивление 8 физическому урону и иммунитет точному урону. Она не может сотворять заклинания, активировать предметы, или использовать действия, которые имеют признак `атака` или `воздействие`. Она получает Скорость полета 10 футов и может проникать через крошечные трещины. Цель может @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.AjLSHZSWQ90exdLo]{Развеять} это заклинание.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.sILRkGTwoBywy0BU]{Эффект заклинания: iзность}

items.name: Shadow's Heart
items.description:
This +3 greater striking kukri has a thin, delicate blade that absorbs light.

Activate 1 Interact (illusion, teleportation)

Frequency once per day

Effect You make a melee Strike with shadow's heart and teleport to an open space you can see within 100 feet. If the attack hits, you also leave behind a shadowy, illusory duplicate of yourself that attacks the same target for up to 3 rounds. The illusion has 1 action per round, which it takes on the turn it's created and on your turn each round. It uses this action to move up to 30 feet to a square adjacent to the target and (if the target is adjacent) to attack the target with a [[/r 1d20+28 #Attack Roll]]{+28} attack modifier, dealing [[/r (3d6+16)[slashing]]] damage. The illusion has an AC of 35 and is immediately destroyed by any attack that deals damage or requires a saving throw.

items.name: +1 состояния ко всем спасброскам против магии

Ghiasi's Double.name: Ghiasi's Double
Ghiasi's Double.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. divination

items.description:
